column4: does anyone know how to edit a file through gedit as root while in ubuntu?  it says i dont have the required permissions
gksudo gedit foo
are you doing this from your first-created user?
yes
see how this line is hilighted?
yes
yes
anyway with 800+ in here, it's handy
did you misspeak?  sudo mount /foo is more the command
whatever mountpoint is in fstab, not foo, of course
hmm im just telling u what the tutorial told me to do
it wants me to edit the fstab
sudo mount /foo mounts things, sudo nano /etc/fstab edits that file, not mounting anything
go ahead and edit it, but don't expect that edit command to mount anything :)  you need a "sudo mount /something" for that
i've seen a couple of tutorials telling me to edit the file before mounting my partition
yes, but i'm tryinf to stress that an edit is not a mount command
oh ok
it "just worked" for me, automatically, but some don't have that experience
mine was a laptop, ipw2200
i was able to module-assistant one of those, a cheap one even :)
~$40usd
mine was 10 bucks...so i'm worried that there wont be adapters for it?
find out the chipset, then google
i'll see..
